title: Jimmy Kimmel, Somber but Defiant, Defends Free Speech in Return to ABC
summary: The late-night star said he had not intended to make light of Charlie Kirk’s murder, but he also said that President Trump’s threat against ABC was “anti-American.”

title: Like His Suspension, Kimmel’s Return Draws a Partisan Reaction
summary: Ben Stiller, the actor and comedian, called Mr. Kimmel’s opening words a “brilliant monologue,” while some on the right questioned his authenticity.

title: After Days of Silence, Joe Rogan Weighs In on Kimmel’s Suspension
summary: The influential podcaster said, “I definitely don’t think that the government should be involved, ever, in dictating what a comedian can or cannot say in a monologue.”

title: In a Sudden Shift, Trump Says Ukraine Can Win the War With Russia
summary: President Trump’s pivot could give him room to distance himself from a conflict that he once promised to solve in days or weeks.

title: ‘Your Countries Are Going to Hell’: Trump Airs His Grievances at the U.N.
summary: In a meandering address, President Trump rebuked global institutions and complained about immigration, environmentalists, windmills and more.

title: Trump’s U-Turn on Ukraine Was a Surprise, Zelensky Says
summary: The Ukrainian leader said in an interview on Fox News that Russia’s unwillingness to take steps toward peace had impacted the American president.

title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Speech at the U.N. General Assembly
summary: The president made inaccurate claims about the economy, renewable energy and the mayor of London.

title: South Koreans Describe Fear and Anger After Georgia ICE Raid
summary: Some of the workers arrested this month at a Hyundai-LG factory said that although they had entered the United States under murky circumstances, they had always planned to return home.

title: Despite Trump’s Pressure on Justice Dept., Certain Safeguards Are Beyond His Reach
summary: The criminal justice system has protections that could ultimately give pause to some of President Trump’s moves for revenge.

title: Jury Finds Ryan Routh Guilty of Trying to Assassinate Trump in Florida
summary: A federal jury convicted Ryan Routh, an itinerant building contractor, of attempting to assassinate a major presidential candidate last September.

title: What’s the Dog in Rembrandt’s ‘The Night Watch’? A Longtime Mystery Is Solved.
summary: What inspired that furry figure in the corner of Rembrandt’s celebrated painting? Researchers at the Rijksmuseum say they’ve solved the longtime mystery.

title: On Covid and Autism, Trump Strays From the Science
summary: President Trump has used his position of authority to dole out flawed medical advice dating back to his first term, when he mused about injecting bleach to kill off the coronavirus.

title: Trump Pushes Unproven Link Between Tylenol and Autism
summary: Top U.S. health officials urged pregnant women not to use acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Tylenol, claiming it could cause autism, though studies have been inconclusive. Azeen Ghorayshi, a science reporter for The New York Times, explains.

title: F.D.A.’s Approval of a Drug for Autism Upends Review Process
summary: The agency expanded use of an old drug as a treatment for some people with autism. The endorsement sent some customers scrambling to buy over-the-counter supplements with the same ingredients.

title: Harvard Dean Was Paid $150,000 as an Expert Witness in Tylenol Lawsuits
summary: The Trump administration has cited Dr. Andrea Baccarelli’s expertise to warn against using acetaminophen — the active ingredient in Tylenol — in pregnancy, based on an unproven autism link.

title: Why Take Tylenol During Pregnancy? The Risks of Fevers.
summary: Fevers during pregnancy can be dangerous, and acetaminophen is the go-to treatment for them. Doctors worry what will happen if women are afraid to take it.

title: Camp Mystic to Reopen After Texas Floods, Over Objections From Victims’ Parents
summary: Twenty-seven children and counselors died in the Texas Hill Country camp, and many of their families expressed shock that the retreat on the Guadalupe River would be open for its 100th anniversary.

title: Claudia Cardinale, Actress Who Was ‘Italy’s Girlfriend,’ Is Dead at 87
summary: A sex symbol with girl-next-door appeal, she rose to fame in the 1960s and starred in more than 150 films, including the Oscar-winning ‘8½’ and ‘The Leopard.’

title: Moulton Readies Primary Challenge Against Markey in Massachusetts
summary: The coming Senate collision in the deep-blue state will be a test of the Democratic Party’s appetite for generational change.

title: Adelita Grijalva Wins Arizona House Seat in Special Election, Shrinking G.O.P. Majority
summary: Adelita Grijalva won a special election on Tuesday in a reliably blue patch of her swing state to fill the seat held by her father before his death this year.

title: What the World Gets Wrong About Israel
summary: There are deep political divisions and disagreements in Israel, but the nation’s core security interests are not partisan property.

title: Trump Is Pulling the Plug on Puerto Rico’s Economy
summary: The purge of Puerto Rico’s oversight board could devastate the island’s economy.

title: Aid Flotilla Headed for Gaza Says It’s Under Drone Attack
summary: The vessels were aiming to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. The Israelis have asked that the aid be given to them to distribute.

title: Which Countries Recognize a Palestinian State?
summary: Ashley Wu, a graphics reporter for The New York Times, walks us through the changing map of Palestinian recognition.

title: Stuck in Traffic, Emmanuel Macron Calls Trump About His Motorcade
summary: The French head of state experienced a frustration that many New Yorkers know all too well. He got stuck during the U.N. General Assembly.

title: One Million Evacuated in China as Typhoon Ragasa Barrels Toward Coast
summary: The storm left 14 dead in Taiwan, and flooded Hong Kong and Macau, disrupting flights.

title: Judge in Gilgo Beach Case Spurns Request to Throw Out DNA Evidence
summary: Lawyers for Rex Heuermann, who is charged with killing seven women, made last-ditch attempts to toss crucial evidence, but prosecutors are preparing for an expected trial next year.
